summary: World Heritage Sites are special places around the world that are protected by UNESCO. These sites are important because they represent unique and valuable parts of our planet's culture, history, or nature. Countries nominate these sites, which can be ancient ruins, beautiful landscapes, or significant buildings. There are over 1,200 of these sites in 168 countries, with Italy having the most. UNESCO helps keep these places safe for future generations, ensuring they are preserved and not damaged.
title: World Heritage Site
